utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I cannot believe that you didn’t tell me that we are still married!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Look I was going to tell you!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: When?! After the birth of our first secret child?! Ross didn’t get the annulment; we are still married.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You’re kidding!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh my God!!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ross!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, maybe it wasn’t my best decision. But I just couldn’t face another failed marriage.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, let me just jump in and ask, at what point did you think this was a successful marriage?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Rach, come on, if you think about it, it’s actually kinda funny. Okay, maybe it’s best not to think about it.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, this is inexcusable. I am shocked to my very core!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Phoebe, I told her you already knew.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Another lie. You have a sickness!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ross, just for my own piece of mind, you’re not married to anymore of us are ya?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh! Hey, somebody left their keys. Ooohh, to a Porsche! {Transcriber’s note: Oh come on! Who would leave the keys to their Porsche behind? If I had a Porsche, I’d have the keys surgically attached to my hand!} Hey Gunther, these yours?

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s what I drive. I make four bucks an hour, I saved up for 350 years!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Na-uh! Hey did anybody lose their keys?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Joey, why don’t you put them in the lost and found?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: There’s a lost and found? My shoe!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You left a shoe here?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, I didn’t realize until I got home. I wasn’t gonna walk all the way back down here with one shoe! Y’know what? I’m gonna go find that guy’s car and leave a note on the windshield.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh good, when he comes back for his keys, I’ll be sure to give him your shoe.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Great! Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, good, good, you guys are here! Listen, how would like to spend tomorrow taking care of three incredibly cute little puppies?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God, what a fun day! That sounds great!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, all right.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, well I’ll bring them by tomorrow morning. Okay, and uh, by the way, they’re not actually puppies, they’re Frank and Alice’s triplets. Okay, see ya!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Whoa-whoa-whoa! What?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Please! Please! Please! Please! Oh please! Please! Please! Frank and Alice asked me to baby sit the triplets and I’m nervous ‘cause I’ve never done that before by myself!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Don’t worry about it Phoebe, we’ll absolutely do it.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m gonna pass. ‘Cause I was kinda iffy when it was puppies.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Come on Chandler, come on! It’ll give us great practice for when——people with babies come to visit.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s not mine.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: I love your car.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s mine.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: I bet it’s fast.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Me too! Yeah. And comfortable. Do uh, do you like leather seats?

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: It’s got ‘em!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So, I still have boxes here. I still have boxes at Ross’s, and I have nowhere to live! Wow. I could so easily freak out right now.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What about me? I just found out that Denise is leaving town for a while, I don’t have a roommate.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, maybe-maybe I could be your roommate Pheebs.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Maybe you could be my roommate!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well there’s an idea!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: That would be great! Wait, how long is Denise gone for?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Umm, she said she’d be back December 26th.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: December 26th, huh maybe she’s Santa Clause.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh look who it is, my husband. The apple of my eye.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, I got us a court date for tomorrow at 2:00 and I picked up all the forms. I’ll take care of everything.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well sure, if you say you’re gonna take care of everything I have no reason to doubt you. Give me those forms! All right, now I’m gonna do this my way and I don’t want to hear a peep out of you!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay Rach, but…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Op! You’re peeping!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross! Y’know what, I just got—why? Why did you do this?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Look I told you…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I don’t wanna hear "Three failed marriages!"

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Look, if you’d had two failed marriages, you’d understand!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, y’know what? Thanks to you I’m half way there! Ugh! Oh! I am so mad! Ross, I don’t think I have ever been this angry!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What about the time I said we were on a break?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ugh!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Pheebs, how’s it going?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I’m doing okay. I think it’s going well. Do you think they’re having fun? Am I talking to fast?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Nope, sound like me. Pheebs, it’s going great. Look at Chandler with little baby girl Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Little baby girl Chandler, where I have heard that before? Oh right, Coach Ruben. Do you know what Pheebs? When you’re done over there, we kinda have a situation over here too.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Na-uh, no, we are all responsible for our own babies.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: See that’s where I think that you’re wrong. We’ve been playing these babies man for man; we should really be playing a zone defense.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I just think that things would go a lot smoother if we each have our own zone. Phoebe, you can be in charge of wiping. And y’know Mon, you can be in charge of diapering and I can be in charge of looking how cute they are when they put their hands around…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That sounds really great, but maybe you should be in charge of wiping.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, I’m a rookie. I should not be in the end zone.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: This is so great! This is exactly how we set the plates at the restaurant.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah? Well this is not what I ordered.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey guys!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey babies! Oh, I’m having the best morning. That uh, that Porsche I’ve got the keys too, still there!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Shocking! Since you still have the keys.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You should see the treatment I get when I’m with that car! People are friendly; they-they wanna talk, and not just about the car! One guy gave me advice about my equity investments.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What equity investments?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: The ones that got me the Porsche! Will you keep up! But I figured, if-if people keep seeing me just standing there, they’re gonna start to think that I don’t own it. So I figured I’ll wash it. Right? Monica, you got a bucket and some soap I can borrow?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh yeah, I got soap and sponges and rags and Carnuba wax and polishing compound.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You don’t even have a car!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I know. But umm, one time there was this really dirty car in front of the building, so I washed it.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: And six others.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: There you are.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, she tops out at 130.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: And that’s just in the city. I get her up to 160 when I take her upstate.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Sure!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, take it easy.

utterance.speaker: The Porsche Owner
utterance.content: Hey! That’s my car.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Really? Oh uh, oh just give me five more minutes with it.

utterance.speaker: The Porsche Owner
utterance.content: What-what are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh I-I uh, found the keys and now I’m just polishing her up.

utterance.speaker: The Porsche Owner
utterance.content: But it’s my car!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, but it’s my wax.

utterance.speaker: The Porsche Owner
utterance.content: Listen, I-I-I don’t come to this city much so I don’t know if you’re crazy or this is some kind of street theater, but could I have my keys.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Sure. Here. I’ll uh, save your parking spot.

utterance.speaker: The Porsche Owner
utterance.content: I’m not coming back.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: The Porsche Owner
utterance.content: I live upstate.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, so did I.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I don’t know why I was so nervous about this. And I don’t know why Frank and Alice are always complaining. This is so easy.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, two hours, a lifetime that’s the same.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Check it out! Check it out! When the babies wake up, they can meet Krog!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Chandler, what are you doing? That thing can put someone’s eye out!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: He can do more than that! He can destroy the universe!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No Chandler, they can swallow one of those little parts! And also, look at his smooth area, that’s just gonna mess them up.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: They’re not gonna swallow anything, you guys are being way over protective. When I was a kid, my mom used to just throw me into a pile of broken glass!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Glass, sand, whatever.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, look at little Leslie stretching in her sleep.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh it’s so cute. I wonder what age it is when you stop being able to put both legs over your head.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, I can still do that.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: How are you still single?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right. I thought about it and maybe you’re right. Maybe Krog is not a safe toy.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Good. What made you change your mind?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I swallowed the sonic blaster gun.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: How did that happen?!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, I was trying to prove that I was right. Y’know? And it turns out I was wrong. And now it’s lodged in my throat.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Damnit! Y’know this whole time we were concentrating on watching the babies and, and no one was watching Chandler!

utterance.speaker: Judge
utterance.content: Okay you two are asking the court for an annulment?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes your honor, and here are, are forms, all filled out.

utterance.speaker: Judge
utterance.content: So based on your petition you are seeking an annulment on the grounds that Mr. Geller is mentally unstable.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Fine, I’m mentally unstable.

utterance.speaker: Judge
utterance.content: And based on the fact that Mr. Geller is intravenous drug user.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Uh yes, heroin and crack.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Crack isn’t even an intravenous drug!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, you would know.

utterance.speaker: Judge
utterance.content: Now it also says here that you lied about your sexual preference before marriage?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, come on!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross, please, I found the magazines!

utterance.speaker: Judge
utterance.content: And finally that you were unable to consummate the marriage. Well, that makes sense since you’re gay and addicted to heroin.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, I’m sorry, this is insane! I-I-I’m not addicted to heroin, I’m not gay, and there is no problem with my ability to consummate anything! Look, I’ll consummate this marriage right here, right now!

utterance.speaker: Judge
utterance.content: That won’t be necessary.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: And when we were dating we consummated like bunnies!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ugh!

utterance.speaker: Judge
utterance.content: Now if you were two involved in a serious relationship, that really creates a problem.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross! Your honor, rest assured relationship ended like two years ago! And could you strike "Consummated like bunnies" from the record?

utterance.speaker: Judge
utterance.content: Is there, anything in this record that is actually true?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, yes, we got married in Vegas and uh, and the names I think.

utterance.speaker: Judge
utterance.content: Well, based on what I heard, you two certainly don’t qualify for an annulment. If you two don’t want to be together you’ll have to file for divorce.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That’s great! Are you happy now? Look what you did with your funny, funny form!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?! Me?! What about you and your consummated like bunnies nonsense!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: And what——What are you typing that for? Did you hear what she said? We don’t get the annulment. Don’t type that! What?! Stop typing! Hey! Stop typing! Stop typing! Stop typing!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, do you see, do you see what you’re keeping me married too?!

utterance.speaker: Judge
utterance.content: You need to get out of my chambers.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right look lady here is the deal, I came here for an annulment and I am not leaving here until I get one!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Judge
utterance.content: Would you like to spend the night in jail?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And thank you for your time.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So the Porsche guy took his car back.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: But you found the keys to his clothes?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No. No, I just uh, I just loved the way it feels when everybody thinks I own a Porsche.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: And people will think you own a Porsche because you’re wearing the clothes?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Of course! Only an idiot would wear this stuff if you didn’t have the car! Right?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That is true.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, but only a genius would swallow a sonic blaster gun.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, I’ve been there. Yeah, I am gonna go drive my Porsche.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Joey, you know you don’t actually have one.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Come on! What are you doing?! I’m in character! Would you talk to her!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ahh, I think it just moved. It’s really poking me.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right, that’s it, we’re going to the emergency room.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What?! No, you can’t, you can’t leave me here with them! We’re baby-sitting!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: The babies are asleep, I’m sure you’ll be okay on your own for a while!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: But you-you can’t leave me with them! We-we’re a team! We’re playing a zone! They’re gonna triple team me!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: He’s got something plastic lodged in his throat, we’ve got to go to the hospital.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: But no, because a doctor won’t be able to help him, it’s just gonna y’know naturally pass through his system in like seven years.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I think that’s gum.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I’m pretty sure it’s gun.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, listen this really hurts. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: A real man wouldn’t just run to the hospital! No! What would, what would Krog do?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Why isn’t that valet back with my Porsche?

utterance.speaker: Passerby
utterance.content: Maybe because you’ve got the keys?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Porsche.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: This is totally your fault!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: My fault?! You threatened the judge!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, you ripped the paper out of the court reporter’s machine!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That was the only way I could get him to stop typing!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hi! How are the Gellers?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Don’t call us that!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: The judge wouldn’t let us get an annulment! Now we gotta get a divorce!! Did a Porsch throw up on you?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey! It’s Porsche!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Me taking care of you is no problem, huh? You guys feel safe. Right? Okay, I’m gonna take that spit bubble as, "Yeah, I do!" Okay, after I get rid of this dirty diaper Leslie, I’ll set you up with a clean one. Okay, I’m sorry. I didn’t mean to scare you. I just have to clean that up. Okay? ‘Cause let’s face it, we’re at Monica’s. I broke it. All right. Well, that’s just the way that goes. Okay, good. Why are there only two of you? Where is Leslie? Well, you can’t answer. Leslie? Where are you Leslie? Leslie, now would be a good time for your first words! Well, look at you! Hey! You are a little bit mischievous! My gosh! Oh, you’re a lot mischievous! Well, it’ll dry. Okay, you sit with your brother and sister now—who aren’t there!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: How do you feel?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, let’s just say that Krog will be fully equipped to destroy the universe again in twelve to fourteen hours.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, so I totally took care of the babies all by myself! I fed ‘em, bathed ‘em, and put ‘em to bed.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And protected them from a tornado?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I know, the babies are asleep.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Phoebe, what, what happened here?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I did it! I took care of the babies all by myself!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: But my apartment!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Was the setting of Phoebe’s triumph.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: But the mess!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Is not as important as the fact that Phoebe took care of the babies all by herself.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You’re right, you’re right I shouldn’t freak out. ‘Cause this is what will happen when you and I have babies! When will that be?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Phoebe, would you take a look at this mess!!!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh honey thank God you’re home, I was getting worried.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I picked up the divorce papers. Uh, I’ve already signed everything and I put little ‘X’s where you need to sign.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, little ‘X’s! Great! That makes up for everything!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Y’know, I-I—you’ve done a lot of stupid stuff too! Okay?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, name one stupid thing that is as stupid as this one!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, how about you flew to London to stop my wedding! Ah, how about you told me you loved me after I was already married!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey! Wait a minute! That was different! I did those things because I was in love with you!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah! Right!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You’re right. That’s very different. So let’s, let’s just sign the papers. All right? What?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, can we just sign please?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Uh-hmm.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Congratulations.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay Ross, we’re—wait a minute. Umm, I uh, I kinda have a little confession.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, y’know this whole marriage thing, kinda my idea.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, remember how we were too drunk to remember anything the night we were married?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And uh, yeah, I didn’t really, I didn’t want to say anything, but it kinda it just, it kinda kept coming back to me, and umm, remember we were in the casino and for some reason thought it would be funny to eat a lot of grapes. And uh, and I thought it would be funnier if we got married. So as a, as a compromise we decided first to get married, and then to eat a lot of grapes. So umm, sorry I got us into this mess.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So then if-if—I mean if you think about it, this is all your fault.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, don’t push it though.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I’ve got to say; I know I divorce a lot of women, never thought I would be divorcing you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I know. I always thought if you and I got married, it would be the one that stuck. And it wouldn’t be a secret, and we wouldn’t have our wedding dinner at Pizza Hut.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Did I, did I even treat?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, it was on the house, it was, it was a newlywed special.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That may be the most depressing thing I’ve heard in my life. I should probably get these to my lawyer’s office.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey, thanks Ross, for taking care of all of this.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Eh, no problem.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I’m gonna need a copy of those.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Totally.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey! Hey! Be careful around my Porsche!

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Hi Joey.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey! How you doin’?

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: He has the most amazing Porsche under there!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I’d love to show ya, but I just tucked her in. She’s sleeping. Hey uh, would you two girls like to go for a drink?
